item.title: Complexity
item.description: Inherent complexity Given a task to solve, the inherent complexity of the problem is a statement oabout how complex the problem is, not about how complex your solution to the problem is. Accidental complexity The accidental complexity of a task is a statement about how much complexity your solution has added on top of the inherent complexity. Good, well-engineered software should aim to minimise the accidental complexity. How do we do this?
